page.title: 09Country Park ,Dorset.
page.content: About one quarter of our 12 km block is farmland;enclosed rough grazing grassland used mainly for cows.Some of the land is wet land, lying adjacent to the River Crane,and too wet for use in the Winter months though it is grazed in the Summer. Although we counted 20 farms marked in our block on the map,few were still in use as farms.Some farm land (eg Hope Cottage Farm,Harkwood Farm etc) has already been built over,farm land at Three Legged Cross is being used for 'pick-your-own'soft fruit. At Kings Farm 82 acres have been set aside for use as a Country Park.A lake for water sports has already been excavated,the earth removed being used for land-scaping the area.1300 trees have been planted.Rights of way over the land will be preserved.Many sports,including golf,are planned.
